title1: « On the Internet, nobody knows you're a dog »
article1: Cyberspace will be liberatory because gender, race, age, looks, or even 'dogness' are potentially absent or alternatively fabricated or exaggerated with unchecked creative license for a multitude of purposes both legal and illegal.
article2a: Billions of people use cell phones and the internet now and hundreds of millions more are expected to come online in the next decade.
article2b: At the same time, more than half of those who use the internet and cell phones still do not use that connectivity for shopping, banking and other important transactions and key social interactions. As more people move online globally both opportunities and threats will grow.
title3: You lost your password, shame on you!
article3:
Shame on you!
Shame on you!
